 How Wildfires Work  So far this year, 36,138 wildfires have burned more than 1.3 million acres. Fires recently
threatened the resort town of Avalon on Catalina
Island and scorched part of Griffith Park, the largest urban park in the United States.
Fires continue to rage in Florida, Georgia and
several other states. In this article, learn about wildfires, their causes and
the sophisticated methods used to fight them.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 

How Maps
Work - Maps are
a convenient method of illustrating a wide variety of data. They're not simply
limited to geography and travel routes -- maps can be used to describe numerous
different types of physical, political and thematic conditions. In this
article, learn how maps use a "graphic language" to present information in an
easily understandable way.
 

How Crop
Circles Work - Are crop
circles the work of alien visitors? Are they a natural phenomenon, created by
electrically charged currents of air? Or are they elaborate hoaxes perpetrated by
savvy, talented and very determined artists? Find out the theories behind crop
circles, see pictures of some famous designs, and learn how to make a crop
circle.
 

How the
World Wildlife Fund Works - The World
Wildlife Fund works to safeguard nature and its ecological processes, preserve
endangered species and reduce pollution. Find out how this important
organization works, the strategies it employs and how you can help.

How
Magazine Printing Works - Have you
ever wondered how millions of magazines are printed every year? Watch this
video from HowStuffWorks to see how modern-day magazine printing works.
